title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Saint Paul, MN)
Interview Descriptions: There is a phone interview with a recruiter who helps to find the right location with the hours and flexibility I need. Then an in person interview with the Nursing Director.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a resident fell? How do you handle an upset resident?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Prior Lake, MN)
Interview Descriptions: As a internal hire, I thought the interview process was stress free and informal which was nice. The management at the facility I interviewed answered all my questions right there.  The process did not make me nervous at all.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 2 years

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (New Hartford, NY) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call for an interview a couple weeks later. I met with the nurse manager and then took a tour.  I was offered the job. I set up to do new hire paperwork then.
Interview Questions: Tell me why you decided to be a nurse.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Bloomington, MN)
Interview Descriptions: I met with the clinical director and social worker and they asked me about my experience as a CNA. They also asked a lot of questions regarding how I would or have handled specific situations in the field. I would have liked to discuss more details regarding their tuition reimbursement and loan forgiveness, I am still unclear on those details after research and a follow up email
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you made a difference in a resident’s life

title: Server/Waiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Woodbury, MN) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was called in to talk very briefly to the head and assistant chef. It was very casual and not stressful at all.  The main reason was to see if I was serious about the job or not.
Interview Questions: What is your plan in the future?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Saint Paul, MN) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It’s Easy. One phone screening. One at the facility. Takes 10 day from application to get hired. They will tell you if you got the job right after the interview. Do background checks and orientation the nextday after interview
Interview Questions: What do you do if a resident fall?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called for a quick phone interview followed by an in person interview the next day. Was referred to a different location to interview in-person for a position there. Both interviewers were kind and seemed like they wanted to get to know me.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you went above and beyond

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Cambridge, MN) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with Nurse Manager, toured the facility while discussing related experience.  Met in the manager's office to complete interview.  We talked about the organization, the structure of the staffing and types of care provided.
Interview Questions: When have you had to deal with a controversial issue with a coworker?

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Arden Hills, MN) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a very comfortable interview. I had one phone interview and a face to face. I was given a brief tour and was able to speed along the hiring process by filling out paperwork immediately.
Interview Questions: What kind of previous experience do you have?

title: Billing Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Roseville, MN)
Interview Descriptions: I thought the interview process went well.  I was interviewed by 3 people and it all seemed to go smoothly.  I went through a recruiter and I received all call the next day that they said I was dressed inappropriately and was unprofessional! I was wearing a long dress, with ruffles and a suede suit coat.  Nothing was unprofessional about that, in fact, rather on the conservative side.  The main interviewer, on the other hand, was wearing a dress with leggings underneath, which I find tacky.  I was very professional but the interview was rather laid back and casual.  I would not want to work for women who find it ok to pick apart how I look and dress while taking no heed of their own appearance..
Interview Questions: The one question that stumped me and I had trouble answering was whether or not I would be ok with mandatory prayer and scripture reading in the mornings.  I have never been asked such a thing and having worked in corporate America, I have been a believer in keeping religion at home.  I didn't really know who to answer that.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, phone screening/interview with someone from their corporate office. If you are a fit, you will be offered a sit down interview.  I was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: What are your long-term goal?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Oak Park Heights, MN)
Interview Descriptions:
Honestly they do a background check to make sure you are not a horrible person then ask you a few questions about yourself and take automated tests. No actual interview questions.

However, they only hire people who already have a relative there even if you are the more qualified candidate.
Interview Questions: They didn't even challenge you.

title: Server Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Plymouth, MN) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I talked to the supervisor about salary and if I had applied to other locations. Then he showed me around the kitchens and told me he'd let me know if I got the job.
Interview Questions: Did you apply to any other locations?

title: Server/Waiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Wayzata, MN)
Interview Descriptions: After a roughly 30 minute personality test on their computer, I interviewed with two supervisors. The interview was easy, with basic questions asked. The people were nice and said to expect a call within the week. However, I never got the call.
Interview Questions: How would you feel after having a stressful and busy workday?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services
Interview Descriptions:
Initial contact kind and efficient. Rapid response to questions. Interview scheduled efficiently. Tour of facility and company philosophy explanation thorough. Job expectations thorough and clear.
Interview had insightful and well thought out questions pertaining to the job I would be doing. Interviewer made the interview comfortable in surroundings as well as demeanor. Positive interview and hiring process. I appreciated the professionalism of the interviewer and the overall process.
Interview Questions: ?...I found the questions not difficult. They were thought provoking and intended to get to know me as a worker and a person.

title: Maintenance Worker I Or II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Pewaukee, WI) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great, manager and HR were great. Till you had to deal with HR after being hired. Supervisor straight shooter, no BS, always honest about the any situation.
Interview Questions: Was none

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services
Interview Descriptions: NA
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Cambridge, MN) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: 1:1 with HR manager and then with nursing manager.
Interview Questions: Why would you want to work here?

title: Server Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (Woodbury, MN) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online during the summer. Forgot I had even applied to it. Received a phone call in September stating they were interested in my resume. Went in September. Lady that interviewed me was the Kitchen Director. She wasn't even on time. Stood in the kitchen for about 10 minutes then was finally noticed. Will never forget that day. Lady was friendly but seemed distracted by other things. Didn't get a callback until November.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult customers?

title: Maintenance Mechanic Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Presbyterian Homes & Services (New Hartford, NY) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: very thorough process - background, criminal, drugs, the whole process
Interview Questions: none really
